q_en: Which workgroup has the highest remaining workload for all sewing tasks that have been started but not yet completed?

steps.sql: SELECT working_group_id, (planned_number - completed_number) AS remaining_workload FROM sewing_tasks WHERE status = 1;
steps.description: Retrieve the IDs and remaining workload for all sewing tasks that have been started but not yet completed

steps.sql: SELECT working_group_id, SUM(remaining_workload) AS total_remaining_workload FROM (SELECT working_group_id, (planned_number - completed_number) AS remaining_workload FROM sewing_tasks WHERE status = 1) AS ongoing_tasks GROUP BY working_group_id;
steps.description: Calculate the total remaining workload for each workgroup

steps.sql: SELECT working_group_id FROM (SELECT working_group_id, SUM(remaining_workload) AS total_remaining_workload FROM (SELECT working_group_id, (planned_number - completed_number) AS remaining_workload FROM sewing_tasks WHERE status = 1) AS ongoing_tasks GROUP BY working_group_id) AS workload_summary ORDER BY total_remaining_workload DESC LIMIT 1;
steps.description: Identify the workgroup with the highest remaining workload

steps.sql: SELECT name FROM working_group WHERE id = 2;
steps.description: Retrieve the name of the workgroup with the highest remaining workload

response:
Sure thing! Based on the data, the workgroup with the highest remaining workload for all sewing tasks that have been started but not yet completed is **Master Sewers**. Here's a quick summary for you:

| Workgroup ID | Workgroup Name | Total Remaining Workload |
|--------------|----------------|--------------------------|
| 2            | Master Sewers  | 40                       |

It looks like the Master Sewers have a bit of work ahead of them! Keep up the great work, team! üòÑ‚úÇÔ∏è
